Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto a palimpsest, a text over a washed-off drawing in red ink, most probably representing a standing king who is bringing an offering. The seven lines of the later text contain a letter concerning certain commodities and the payment for a donkey. On the verso a drawing in black ink of a figure of a walking man with a knife in one hand, his body painted red.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136373) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136373)
